question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Genesis/BasicContractZeroReferenceState.cs] [Class: BasicContractZeroState] [Namespace Pollution] Since the class is in the AElf.Contracts.Genesis namespace, could an attacker deploy a malicious contract in the same namespace that interferes with these reference state properties through namespace-level access? (High)
